result.execSummary:
The defendant Caleb M. Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  AODA/treatment per agent.  Defendant has 4 days credit if probation revoked.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Atty O'Rourke acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial.  Bond continued.

Defendant Caleb M. Turner in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty O'Rourke states DE will waive his right to prelim.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.

Return date on January 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Return date on December 23, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Caleb M. Turner in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advises defendant did not appear at PTC.  Defendant would like more time to seek counsel.  Court allows more time.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for December 23, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
no controlled substances w/o valid Rx; Absolute Sobriety

Pre-trial conference on November 14, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Return date on November 26, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Caleb M. Turner appeared by video means with Attorney Ankenbrandt. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has not yet applied.  Likely to not qualify.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State gives warrant and criminal record.  State request cash bond.  Attorney Ankenbrandt argues bond.  Ties to community & employed.  Time limits waived.  $1000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No controlled substances without a valid Rx.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for November 26, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
